Fast paced, Team orientated, and horror frenzy. that's what I would say about this title.
If you are tired of your Call of Duty Zombie campaigns with friends, and want a taste of the real ultra violence, I would recommend this 100%.
User created maps, classes from Melee to fully automatic assault rifles, this game is gory AS HELL. I don't think you'll regret playing this with your friends, especially when the slow-motion kicks in.  This isn't really a game for the faint of heart, either. We're talking ultra violence, limb exploding, pyschotic dream land.
You're gonna have fun.

And there are a few experienced players you will occasionally meet when playing on beginner or normal difficulties and they will help you out by giving you some tips or just babysit you and not let you get torn to pieces.

Multiplayer is gone. I can't find any online servers these days.

I got Killing Floor recently along with KF2, so I can't say I'm an "OG" player as the cool kids like to say nowadays. 
That being said... I really enjoy this game. 
       I played the second one first, then tried out this one. I like both games equally. The Killing Floor games are a lot of fun, and I've been playing them non-stop, switching back and forth between the two. Sure, this game is a bit old, but I still find it really fun to play. 

I'm not sure which one I prefer. I will say that KF2 has some small "quality of life" stuff that the first one lacks. 
[list]
[*] For starters, I like that I can sprint in the second one. I feel so terribly slow in the first one. 
[*] I also like that in the second one, I can melee with any weapon out and stop clots from grabbing me, whereas in the first one I have to switch to my knife to melee or just kill the clots to stop being grabbed. 
[*] One thing I do dislike about the first one is that I can't cancel the reload animation. Let's say I'm in a bad situation and I've just emptied my mag. My character starts reloading the gun, but I want to switch to my other weapon... except I can't. I'm stuck in the reload animation and I can't switch weapons, so I can't kill any zeds. By the time the animation is finished, it reads my weapon switch input and switches weapons even though now there's no point because my current gun has been reloaded. 
[/list]
These are just small things, and I'm glad that I don't have to deal with these nuances in KF2. 

Despite all this, I keep finding myself wanting to play more. Killing Floor is an older game, but there's just a certain charm about it that I can't put into words. It's addicting, it's amusing, and it's fun as hell. This game is a classic and my only regret is not playing it sooner. 
If you're looking for a game that's fun and addicting, has replayability, and is fun to play with friends, then look no further. Killing Floor is that game.

One of the best survival horror games iv'e ever played, 

The soundtrack makes you feel like an absolute badass,
the mix of the electronic and mechanical sound 
along with the heavy and gritty guitar riffs make it a 
damn good fitting soundtrack for it's atmosphere and 
combat.

The combat is exhilarating and makes you jump at certain points,
seriously the first time i played the crawlers scared the absolute
shit out of me but i digress. 

The voice acting could have been a lot better but i mean who really
cares about that when you are fighting a wave of Zeds on Suicidal
difficulty. I just kind of thought the trader's vanilla voice was kind of
awkward and off-putting but like i said when you are neck deep in
Zeds who cares?.

I know the first killing floor is kind of outdated but since i have a toaster PC i decided to try the first one before jumping ahead to number 2 and i'm aware nobody really plays the first killing floor anymore so i guess this review will outdated but whatever i guess.

This was awesome. Time well spent.

Even tho the Sequel improved a lot in terms of Gameplay, This game is still a heck of a lot of fun to play solo or with friends, doesn't have the amount of guns that 2 has, but it still has a nice selection of guns to play with, would totally recommend this game!

Old, but gold and I still believe this is more fun than Killing Floor 2. It's simpler, more intuitive and the graphics are really not that bad given how old the game is. The fights are intense, playing co-op makes it not just more fun but even more challenging and I just wish this game would've still received updates and love after Killing Floor 2 was released. It really deserved it.
fun game but old . still fun tho
